attributes.action: Fertility issues should be treated as medical issues and not lifestyle choices
attributes.additional_details: My employer does not recognise fertility treatment as a medical requirement and although I needed medical appointments, scans, blood work & counselling sessions my employer said it was a lifestyle choice and made me take annual leave for appointments. Speaking to other suffers many employers take the same stance as well as insurance companies.
attributes.background: Acknowledge & support fertility issues & their related medical need as medical treatment & not lifestyle choices & change employment law to recognise them as a medical issue, not a lifestyle choice. The country is naive regarding infertility & although having a child is a choice, infertility is not.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, you could start a new petition asking for the UK Government and Parliament to make time off work for fertility treatment a legal right.
